runners.spotlight: 3yo was kept busy at two, her sole win coming in a Thirsk novice (6f, gd-sft); ran well in big sales races at Naas and Newmarket on yielding and soft ground; has failed to fire in two starts for Adrian Murray at Dundalk; a bit to prove for now.

runners.name: Just Before
runners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith
runners.comment: 7f maiden winner at two on soft, unraced over 6f but may suit on breeding, not discounted
runners.spotlight: 3yo won a 7f maiden at Leopardstown (soft) last season; drops back in trip after a trio of modest efforts at 10.5f-7f this year; this trip is an unknown but she's a half-sister to a 6f winner and the handicapper is giving her a chance; not discounted.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies Maiden
quotes.quote: I was shocked when the handicapper gave Just Before a mark of 74 and disappointed. I thought she was better than that and she obviously is - Willie Browne, trainer

runners.name: Island Girl
runners.owner: Craig Bernick & Mrs M V Magnier & Mrs Paul Shanahan
runners.comment: Maiden, sound efforts both starts this term at Naas, mark has slipped to 73, could go well
runners.spotlight: 3yo remains a maiden after six starts (five on turf); decent efforts both starts this term at Naas over 5f (sft-hvy) and 6f (gd-yld) when splitting Brigid's Cloak and Miracle Beauty; has placed maiden form on good; mark has dropped to 73; could go well.

runners.name: Saturn Seven
runners.comment: Course winner over 5f off 68, 6lb lower now, went close over C&D last season, interesting
runners.spotlight: Is 2-18, won a 5f handicap on soft to heavy here in October 2023 off 68; best run last year came over C&D (good) when beaten a head off 65; ran better than finishing position suggests on return earlier this month; 6lb below last win now; interesting.

runners.name: Brigids Cloak
runners.comment: AW winner, 0-6 on turf, second of 17 latest but beaten 7.5l, 1lb wrong, place claims again
runners.spotlight: AW winner is 0-6 on turf but has run well in defeat; finished second of 17 on latest at Naas when had a couple of today's rivals behind but was 7.5l behind the winner; 1lb wrong here but she has place claims again.

runners.name: Rosato
runners.comment: Won two of last three starts last season, 1lb wrong here and lacks a run, others sharper
runners.spotlight: Won two of final three starts last season at Navan (6f, gd-yld) off 53 and Naas (6f, yielding) off 55; ran well over C&D in October; lacks a run and is 1lb wrong at the weights; not fully discounted but others may be sharper today.

quotes.race: Book Your Discounted Tickets On NavanRacecourse.ie Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Rosato got a bit stuck on the rail at the Curragh and I'd say she was still a bit green as well, it was probably her first time trying to take a gap going forwards rather than backwards. We thought she would win today and we put her in on Monday at Roscommon because we thought she might win and might need to go under a penalty - Charles Weld, trainer.

6:20.race_name: McGuinness Maintenance Services Irish EBF Maiden
6:20.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (Watering) (Racing on Stands' side)

runners.name: Among The Pines
runners.comment: 100-1, slowly away and always behind on belated debut, discounted
runners.spotlight: 100-1, slowly away and always behind on belated debut at Leopardstown twelve days ago; discounted.

runners.name: Freelance Dancer
runners.comment: Long odds and no impact all three starts, hood and tongue tie on, others preferred
runners.spotlight: Triple-figure odds and no impact in three maidens at 6f-1m on varying ground; tongue tie and hood now tried; others appeal more.

runners.name: Super Fly
runners.comment: Struggled in bumpers and on Flat debut at Gowran latest, may need more time
runners.spotlight: Struggled in three bumper runs and similar story on Flat debut at Gowran (1m, good) earlier this month; may need more time.

runners.name: Boomtown Lad
runners.comment: Cheaply bought Elzaam colt, yard not known for maiden winners, watch on debut
runners.spotlight: One of two for yard; cheaply bought Elzaam colt is a seventh foal; half-brother to 1m turf/1m2f AW winner Magical Dragon (RPR 67); dam 5f AW winner (64), half-sister to 5f Listed winner Tropical Treat, out of Listed-placed 5f 2yo winner; yard not known for maiden winners; watch on debut.

runners.name: Collecting Coin
runners.comment: Lope De Vega colt, pleasing debut at Cork, form boosted, should handle ground, go well
runners.spotlight: Lope De Vega colt made a very pleasing debut at Cork (1m, soft) last month when a 2.75l third of 17; form was boosted by the runner up Omni Man this week; different ground here but his dam handled quick conditions; should go well.

stable_tour.quote: He made an excellent start to his racing career at Cork on Saturday. We were very happy with that and he'll come on a ton for it. We'll take him to Leopardstown in about three weeks' time and we think he'll progress through the ranks as the season goes on. 23-04-25

runners.name: Gran Habano
runners.owner: Amo Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar

prev_owners.owner: AMO Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar

runners.comment: Rated 76 on grass, best turf efforts on yielding-heavy, a bit to prove on this ground
runners.spotlight: Nine race maiden rated 80 on AW and 76 on turf; best efforts on grass on easy ground at Gowran the last twice over 1m (yielding) and 7f (heavy); Colin Keane an eye catching booking but has a bit to prove on the likely quicker ground here.

runners.name: Immortal Jock
runners.comment: Beaten 16l on debut at Leopardstown, related to useful winners but may need more time
runners.spotlight: Was a bit short of room on debut at Leopardstown (1m, good) when beaten 16l; Belardo gelding is related to a couple of useful winners and his yard is in form but he may need a bit more time.

runners.name: Poweracclaim
runners.comment: Promise on debut on heavy at Gowran, related to good ground winners, not discounted
runners.spotlight: Acclamation gelding was sent off at 20-1 on debut at Gowran (7f, heavy) but he ran a nice race to finish fifth of 16, just 1l behind Gran Habano; two of his half-brothers have won on good ground so he might improve for this sounder surface; not discounted.

runners.name: Sheamus Seimhiu
runners.comment: Long odds for both starts a year apart, improved effort latest but a lot more needed
runners.spotlight: Sent off long odds for both starts almost a year apart; improved effort at Cork (1m, soft) on latest when finishing in midfield but a lot more needed to win this.

runners.name: Fingerpaint
runners.comment: Kingman filly, sister won for this yard, debutante is from respected source, check market
runners.spotlight: Home-bred Kingman filly is a third foal; sister to winners Samburu (7f/8.5f inc 2yo/US; RPR 105) and Settlement (7f AW; 83); dam 7f 2yo winner (89), sister to US 8.5f Grade 2 winner Set Piece, half-sister to 6f/6.5f Listed winner Alocasia (by Kingman); newcomer from respected source; market should reveal plenty.

runners.name: Quafftide
runners.comment: Home-bred Holy Roman Emperor filly, dam won on debut, worth a market check
runners.spotlight: Home-bred Holy Roman Emperor filly is a second foal; dam 6f-1m AW winner (inc 2yo; RPR 95), closely related to useful 7f/1m1f winner Miramis, half-sister to useful winners Twin Star (1m2f/1m5f) and Breaking Story (7f 2yo/1m); from a family the trainer knows well and dam won on debut; check the market.

runners.name: Senior Situation
runners.comment: Cheaply bought Arizona filly, not much appeal on paper, unlikely winner on debut
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; cheaply bought Arizona filly is a third foal; dam 1m4f turf/2m AW winner (RPR 80), half-sister to 6f 2yo Listed winner Clondinnery and 1m2f/1m4f winner Stony Grey, out of 1m4f Flat and 2m/2m1f hurdle winner; not much appeal on paper and rates an unlikely winner on debut.

runners.name: Valencia
runners.comment: 0-3, smart form in defeat last year behind Swelter and in Goffs Million, the one to beat
runners.spotlight: An 87-rated three-race maiden who ran well on her second and third starts last year; finished 1.75l behind Irish 1000 Guineas hopeful Swelter at Leopardstown (1m, good) in July and not beaten far in the Goffs Million over this C&D in September; holds an Irish Oaks entry; the one to beat if she is fit.

stable_tour.quote: She's a nice maiden who had three good runs last year, including a solid fourth in the Goffs Million. She's done well over the winter and might end up a filly for the Sandringham. 24-04-25

6:55.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (Watering) (Racing on Stands' side)

runners.name: Emit
runners.comment: Just denied in a Cork conditions race over this trip but his best form has been on soft
runners.spotlight: Won a soft-ground Tipperary maiden last year and ran well in Group 3 company after; made a solid reappearance when just denied in a Cork conditions race over this trip; however, his best form has been on soft ground and that is a concern; seems yard's first-string.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Emit is a grand horse. He didn't get the message to go past but when he did he was snug at the line. He's a lovely staying colt - Declan McDonogh, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He had a really good reappearance run at Cork last weekend when a close second and it was a very pleasing effort. He pulled up well afterwards and will either head straight to Ascot or go to the Gallinule first. 24-04-25

runners.name: Reyenzi
runners.breeder: H H The Aga Khan's Studs
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: A 5l 1m2f maiden winner at Navan; yard is going well and there should be more to come
runners.spotlight: Just denied in a 7f Naas maiden on sole start last year after losing plenty of ground at the start; was much sharper on return when a 5l 1m2f maiden winner at Navan; that was on soft but handled good ground on debut; yard is going well and there should be more to come.

runners.name: Shackleton
runners.owner: P M Brant & Mrs J Magnier & M Tabor & Derrick Smith
runners.comment: Course winner is yard first-string; has to be respected even though he lacks a recent run
runners.spotlight: Won a 1m1f maiden on good ground at this course on third start last year before a decent effort in a Newmarket Group 3 over this trip; seems to be his powerful yard's first-string so has to be respected even though he lacks a run this term.

quotes.race: Trainor Stone And Tile Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Shackleton disappointed us last day but Ryan was very happy with him today. He was very green in front and the conditions were tough. He's a middle distance horse for next year - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won at the Curragh last year and was third in the Zetland. He's in good shape and ready to start; we were thinking of running him last weekend. We think he's going to get a mile and a half and he'll be divided up somewhere with options at Lingfield, Leopardstown or Chester. 07-04-25

runners.name: Thrice
runners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith
runners.comment: Beaten a long way over 1m4f in the Chester Vase on return; looks yard second-string today
runners.spotlight: Won a 7f Listowel maiden last year and was fourth in a Leopardstown Group 3 on soft over 1m1f; however, was beaten a long way over 1m4f in the Chester Vase on return and appears to be the yard's second-string today.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Thrice had a good run at the Curragh. He was still a bit babyish here and got a bit lost around some of the bends but he stayed well in the last furlong-and-a-half - Ryan Moore, rider.

runners.name: Tiberius Thunder
runners.owner: Amo Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar
runners.comment: Decent efforts in defeat in pattern company lately; needs a bit more but can be involved
runners.spotlight: Ran green but was still good enough to win a Dundalk maiden on debut over 1m; better efforts at this trip when third in the Group 3 Ballysax Stakes at Leopardstown and fourth in Listed Blue Riband at Epsom; will need a bit more today but shouldn't be far away.

quotes.race: Put The Fun In Fundraising At Dundalk Maiden
quotes.quote: Tiberius Thunder was greener than I thought he would be but he hit the line nice. He will improve plenty and he will stay further - Wayne Lordan, rider.

runners.name: Dawn Spirit
runners.breeder: Al Shira'Aa Farms S A R L
runners.comment: Won a fillies' maiden at Cork last time, galloping on strongly; could get involved
runners.spotlight: The sole filly in the line-up; improved form to get off the mark in a fillies' maiden at Cork (1m2.5f) last time, galloping on strongly; this demands much more but she could make enough improvement to get involved with cheekpieces added

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF 3yo Spring Series Median Auction Fillies Maiden
quotes.quote: Dawn Spirit is a nice filly, has always shown more at home than in her two runs but the last day she didn't like being crowded. She is a big filly and hopefully it is onwards and upwards now. I'm sure she'll have no problem going 1m4f - Dylan Browne McMonagle, jockey speaking to RacingTV.

7:25.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Habitat Handicap (Premier Handicap)
7:25.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (Watering) (Racing on Stands' side)

runners.name: Erosandpsyche
runners.comment: Smart form in 2022, missed 2023, off since last June, new yard, blinkers, check market
runners.spotlight: Smart stakes form in 2022 for Paddy Twomey including a second in the Group 1 Flying Five here on soft; missed all of 2023 and seen just twice last year; showed he retained ability with Cork Listed second in June; off since and blinkers go on for stable debut; check the market.

quotes.race: Doneraile Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: I think it is a very good track and we reckoned going the straight line was the best way home. To be fair to Billy, he was brave and it worked. Erosandpsyche is a very straightforward horse, has a high cruising speed and lots of ability. He has entries in stakes races and will mix and match between handicaps - Paddy Twomey, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Erosandpsyche was good in the stalls today. He was very professional and a real sprinter type. He's a grand horse - Declan McDonogh, jockey.

runners.name: Tango Flare
runners.comment: Excellent run over C&D off 2lb higher last season, has gone well fresh, not dismissed
runners.spotlight: Is 3-16 on turf; last win came in Fairyhouse conditions race last June; excellent run over C&D when a 1.5l third behind My Mate Alfie in the Bold Lad in September and 2lb lower here; has won first time up before; dangerous to dismiss.

runners.name: Little Queenie
runners.comment: 2-24 on turf, two fine handicap efforts here last season, strip fitter for latest, chance
runners.spotlight: Four-time AW winner is 2-24 on turf; has won here over 5f (good) off 78 in August 2023; went close in both handicap starts here last season, beaten a neck over C&D off 87 and 0.5l over 5f off 96; should strip fitter for her comeback at Naas; chance.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Bet 10 Get 50 Sign Up Offer Mourne Handicap
quotes.quote: Little Queenie could go for a Listed race at Tipperary. I think she'll get black type somewhere - Paul Flynn, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladies Day At Dundalk Handicap
quotes.quote: Little Queenie is tough and hardy. Ground probably caught us out the last day but she felt 100% today. They went along and I was happy enough to get the box seat and she picked up well - Robert Whearty, rider.

quotes.race: Gateway Hotel Dundalk Race & Stay Handicap
quotes.quote: Little Queenie is a legend. I had her entered a good few times in the last few weeks but pulled her out because of the ground. We said one way or the other she was going home after this. She'll keep going next year and if we got a bit of black type the owner would be delighted - Paul Flynn, trainer.

quotes.race: Sheehy Motors Skoda Handicap
quotes.quote: I think Little Queenie is just getting stronger now and quicker. A good stiff five is probably ideal with a little bit of juice, as she doesn't like it too quick. We had a few different options and went for the slightly better race. It was great to see her winning it - Paul Flynn, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies & Mares Handicap
quotes.quote: He gave Little Queenie a lovely ride and there was no one to take her on today. The handicapper has given her a chance as well - Paul Flynn, trainer.

runners.name: Heavenly Power
runners.comment: Triple C&D winner, won off 86 here last year and then off 90 at Naas, nice draw, go well
runners.spotlight: One of three for yard; 5-26 on turf; won twice last season, including over C&D (good) off 86; scored off 90 at Naas on final start of 2024; may have needed comeback at Naas; remains 2lb above last win but this triple C&D winner is nicely drawn and could go well.

quotes.race: FBD Hotels And Resorts Killashee Hotel Handicap
quotes.quote: Heavenly Power will probably go straight to the Bold Lad now. I was worried about the ground but he did well - Eddie Lynam, trainer

runners.name: Keke
runners.comment: 5-13, two-time course winner including over C&D, good run on return, should go well
runners.spotlight: Second of three for yard; 5-13 on turf; two-time course winner including over C&D; won four times last season and bolted up over 5f (gd-yld) here last September off 84; good run off 95 on seasonal reappearance here over 5f on soft; return to 6f no problem and should go well, though draw could be better.

quotes.race: SBK Joe McGrath Premier Handicap
quotes.quote: Keke has just kept coming forward all season and to win four handicaps in a year is pretty cool. I would say he'll go on his holidays now. The handicapper will have his say, so we'll come back for the good sprint handicaps next year. When he came to us as a two-year-old he couldn't run a message. But he gradually improved and won his maiden last year. I told the owner to hold onto him and thankfully he did - Eddie Lynam, trainer.

quotes.race: G Dunlop Electrical Handicap
quotes.quote: keke is a horse I would like to try over six. He's not the brightest horse in the world but when you light him up he can be keen. I would hope there might be a bit of improvement in him - Eddie Lynam, trainer

quotes.race: Grimes Maiden
quotes.quote: Keke had a good run last day. Once you get him relaxed he is straightforward. He switched off and travelled well, he was doing enough at the end - Colin Keane, rider

runners.name: Dandyville
runners.comment: 4-17 on turf, good run when last seen at Fairyhouse, new yard, may need this after absence
runners.spotlight: Seven-time winner is 4-17 on turf; went close behind Tango Flare in 6f Fairyhouse conditions race when last seen in June 2024; 6lb better off with that rival here and has moved to Stuart Crawford but may need this after a 350-day absence.

quotes.race: Graeme Woods Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: Dandyville was in good form at home, so we decided to give him an entry. The race looked like it could have been competitive but we decided to run and it has worked out well. He's a very strong finisher and we will see how he comes out of this - Natalia Lupini, trainer

quotes.race: Coast To Curragh Charity Cycle This Saturday September 25th Handicap
quotes.quote: Dandyville is very, very game. He's been in good form since his last run at the Curragh as well. We thought he was drawn on the wrong side of the track at the Curragh - Natalia Lupini, trainer.

quotes.race: Sean Barrett Bloodstock Insurances Ltd Handicap
quotes.quote: Dandyville has been in good form since Fairyhouse. He travelled nicely into the race after he settled well. He's very tough and genuine and is always at his strongest at the end of his race. Hopefully we can compete at premier handicap level - Natalia Lupini, trainer.

runners.name: I Am Superman

prev_owners.owner: M O'Callaghan Racing Limited, J Fleming & M O'Callaghan

runners.comment: 9yo, 7-46 on turf, solid fourth at Naas latest, 4lb lower now, vulnerable to younger legs
runners.spotlight: 9yo is 7-46 on turf; dual Group 2 winner in Australia in his pomp; won a 7f conditions race at Gowran (soft) last May; solid effort when a 1.5l fourth of 15 at Naas latest and 4lb lower here; not discounted but may be vulnerable to younger rivals.

quotes.race: Gowran Park Race
quotes.quote: I Am Superman hated the ground, just being a big strong horse he was able to get through it and get home. He is a very good horse on his day, and the end of last year I had the Buckingham Palace in my head. He is a Group horse and a straight seven at Ascot on fast ground where they go a lick will suit him - Michael O'Callaghan, trainer.

quotes.race: Family Fun Day August Bank Holiday Race
quotes.quote: It was a bit of a confidence booster for the horse and a bit of a relief for myself, because we know he has the ability - he has loads of talent - but at Ascot the whole occasion got to him and he raced too enthusiastically. He blew it by half way, whereas today they went a real good gallop and he travelled well. He did it very professionally. He raced a little bit in Leigh's hands early but he just needs to learn to race a little more - he's still learning. There's plenty more to come from him, he's just gone through the motions in what looked a good enough race on paper. After Ascot, today was about picking up the pieces and we'll figure out a plan from here - Michael O'Callaghan, trainer of I Am Superman

quotes.race: Blackwater Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: I Am Superman is a horse we always thought a lot of and he's making shapes of being a very nice horse. He made them look like handicappers. We might run him in the Tetrarch and if he came through that we can think about running in the Irish 2000 Guineas - Michael O'Callaghan, trainer.

quotes.race: Leopardstown Summer Pass Handicap
quotes.quote: I thought that was good performance carrying top weight and from that draw. He wasn't the quickest away but Leigh kept him out wide on the fresh ground down the back and at the apex of the bend was able to slot in in front and set his own fractions. He won well and he said he was just idling in front. I'm delighted with him and delighted that he's come good because we did think he was a nice horse last year. Hopefully he can progress well - Michael O'Callaghan, trainer

runners.name: Daamberdiplomat
runners.comment: Three-time AW winner, 1-13 on turf, rated 3lb lower than on AW, opposable on turf form
runners.spotlight: Three-time AW winner is 1-13 on turf, the win coming in a C&D maiden on good in 2022; hasn't troubled the judge on turf since; rated 3lb lower than on the AW but opposable off current mark on the balance of his turf form.

quotes.race: Christmas Party Nights At Dundalk Stadium Handicap
quotes.quote: Six furlongs and coming off a good gallop on this surface really suits DAAMBERDIPLOMAT. He does get seven but a proper strongly-run six is ideal for him. He's good fresh so we liked his chance coming here this evening - Ben Coen, rider

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: I did not feel Daamberdiplomat had progressed at home but that was pretty impressive. He settled better dropping back in trip, I am not sure where we will go next but we will be in no rush. We might look at the Killavullan later in the year - Johnny Murtagh, trainer.

runners.name: Apache Outlaw

prev_owners.owner: Dooley Thoroughbreds & J Fairhurst & Paul Riley
Dooley Thoroughbreds & J Fairhurst & Paul Riley

runners.comment: 2-25 on turf, won here over 5f last October off 2lb higher, in form on AW, place claims
runners.spotlight: Four-time AW winner is 2-25 on the grass; sound effort over C&D on penultimate when a 2.25l fourth of 12 on soft off 89; ran well again at Newcastle on latest off 100; won here over 5f (good) in October off 84 and just 2lb higher now; place claims.

quotes.race: Christmas Party Nights At Dundalk Stadium Handicap
quotes.quote: Apache Outlaw has improved plenty and is an out-and-out sprinter who enjoys a fast pace. We might come back for the all-weather finals at Newcastle - Ado McGuinness, trainer.

quotes.race: Fleetwood Paints Handicap
quotes.quote: Apache Outlaw was off a nice weight today. He travelled into the race today probably better than any of his runs over five or six, he was just on form today - Adam Caffrey, rider.

runners.name: Mehman
runners.comment: Won at Naas last May off 10lb lower, beaten fav' at Dundalk latest, low draw, tough mark
runners.spotlight: Sole turf win came at Naas last May off 75 (5f, good); won off 77 over 6f at Dundalk in January; hiked up 11lb for that and couldn't follow up when the 5-4 favourite back there in March; drawn low and may be on a tough mark.

quotes.race: Floodlit Fridays At Dundalk Handicap
quotes.quote: Mehman has been very consistent and he was in top shape. He popped nice and clean and it set up nicely - Declan McDonogh, jockey.

quotes.race: Danny Trundle Heating & Plumbing Handicap
quotes.quote: Shane did well to get through plenty of traffic and he said that's his ground. We'll probably go back to the Curragh and find a nice sprint for Mehman - Ger O'Leary, trainer.

quotes.race: Happy New Year From Dundalk Stadium Handicap
quotes.quote: Mehman is a horse we've always loved, he shows a lot of class and speed. He could well be better than this grade but he is so big that he has just needed time. He could be kept on the go - Adrian Joyce, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Barbapapa
runners.comment: 1-5 on turf, went well on last turf start at Naas, off since last August, new trip, watch
runners.spotlight: Two-time AW winner is 1-5 on turf; only seen three times last season; went close at Naas after a 187-day absence last June (1m, good) off 80; not beaten far in valuable 7f Newcastle handicap when last seen in August; never raced over this short a trip; probably best watched.

runners.name: Collective Power
runners.comment: Is 3-30 on turf, ran better than result latest, good effort here in August, well drawn
runners.spotlight: Third runner for yard; eight-time winner is 3-30 on turf; won at Dundalk in April off 82 for this rider; ran better than bare result back on turf when behind a few of these at Naas latest (6f, gd-yld); was 4.25l behind Keke on last visit to this venue last August and with rider's claim is 15lb better off here; interesting from decent draw.

quotes.race: Racing TV Club Day Handicap
quotes.quote: Collective Power had a chance I thought. They didn't go much of a gallop early on and I was taking him back the whole time. He met a bit of interference but he quickened up well - Sorcha Woods, rider

quotes.race: Follow Us On Instagram Handicap
quotes.quote: Collective Power travelled sweetly, took me there well, and I was mindful not to get there too soon. They went a good gallop which is important for him - Billy Lee, rider.

runners.name: Mickey The Steel
runners.comment: Course winner over 5f on soft, ground may be too quick here, drawn low, 2lb wrong
runners.spotlight: AW winner is 4-43 on turf; has won here over 5f on heavy off 89; has multiple placed efforts over C&D but best efforts have come on softer ground than he's likely to encounter here, he's 2lb wrong and he's drawn low.

quotes.race: Colm Quinn BMW Handicap
quotes.quote: Mickey The Steel loves that ground and he was just keeping going and going. He did it well - Wesley Joyce, rider

runners.name: Ohailbhic
runners.comment: AW winner, 0-6 on turf but has run well in defeat, come on for latest, 2lb wrong, low draw
runners.spotlight: AW winner is 0-6 on turf; best efforts have come at Naas over 6f on good ground; should come on for seasonal reappearance when not beaten far at Cork (7f, good); handicapper has given him a big chance but the draw gods have not been kind and he's 2lb wrong.

runners.name: Gerrits Gem
runners.comment: 6f Cork maiden winner, heavy ground excuse latest, nice draw, could go well; 4lb wrong
runners.spotlight: Two-time turf winner; won his maiden at Cork over 6f (good) last May; added a 1m handicap at that venue off 74 in October on yielding; attracted market support for his comeback at Naas in March but struggled on soft to heavy; 4lb wrong but might make a bold bid from a nice draw back at 6f.

runners.name: Moltophino
runners.comment: Went close on return at Naas, low draw, 4lb wrong, previous form at this venue not great
runners.spotlight: Fifteen race maiden; went close to gaining first win at Naas (6f, gd-yld) on seasonal return in first-time tongue tie and cheekpieces (retained); however, he hasn't produced his best in two previous visits to this venue and is drawn low; 4lb wrong.

7:55.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (Watering) (Racing on Stands' side)

runners.name: Akashaa
runners.comment: No impact in maidens over C&D and at Down Royal over 7f, probably one for handicaps
runners.spotlight: Has finished down the field in maidens here (6f, good) and at Down Royal (7f, yielding); will qualify for handicaps after this.

runners.name: Bonus Time
runners.comment: Promising second on debut at Cork (6f, good), should improve, obvious chance
runners.spotlight: Too Darn Hot filly ran a promising race when second of 10 at Cork (6f, good) on debut earlier this month (Suerte 3.25l behind); should be improvement to come and she holds obvious claims.

runners.name: Charasson
runners.comment: Kodiac newcomer, sister to Ano Syra who has won four for this yard, worth a market check
runners.spotlight: Kodiac filly is a fifth foal; sister to winners Ano Syra (5f/6f inc AW: RPR 108) and Colour Image (1m; 94), half-sister to 1m winner Ano Manna (72); dam 6f 2yo winner (93), half-sister to 6f 2yo Group 2 winner Carrizo Creek, out of 2m winner; trainer knows the family well and worth a market check on debut.

runners.name: Cold Hearted
runners.comment: Is 0-6, rated 76, strip fitter for comeback third over C&D, place chance on best form
runners.spotlight: Is 0-6 and rated 76; shaped like may have needed her return in a C&D maiden last month in first-time cheekpieces (retained); best effort a 0.5l second of 12 in a fillies' maiden on yielding at Naas (6f) last October; place chance on best form.

runners.name: Glasheen Girl
runners.breeder: Mary Hogan, Martin Lynn & Nigel Lynn
runners.comment: Huge odds and well beaten both starts at 7f-1m, drops in trip, seems safe to rule out
runners.spotlight: Huge odds and never landed a blow in maidens at Dundalk (7f) in October and at Naas (1m, good) earlier this month; drops in trip but looks safe to rule out.

runners.name: Glory To Be
runners.comment: 27,000Gns Cotai Glory debutante, dam related to two Listed winners, worth a market check
runners.spotlight: Cotai Glory filly cost 27,000Gns as a yearling; first foal; dam placed 1m-8.5f (RPR 73), half-sister to winners Shanghai Glory (6f Listed) and Choose Me (7.4f Listed; dam of Group 1 winners Persuasive and Creative Force), out of 1m2f winner; makes some appeal on paper so check the market.

runners.name: Naoi
runners.comment: 3-1 and stayed on over 7f on debut at Cork, form has worked out, drops to 6f, chance
runners.spotlight: Sent off at 3-1 for debut at Cork (7f, good) in early-April and ran on well from the back for a 3l third of 11; the winner of that race is now rated 95 after placing in a Group 3; the drop back to 6f is not an obvious move but she has strong form claims.

runners.name: Never Not Lucky
runners.comment: Rated 74, best effort a 1.5l fourth at Naas last October, place claims with repeat; hooded
runners.spotlight: Rated 74 after three runs; standout effort last season a 1.5l fourth of 12 behind Miracle Beauty at Naas (6f, yielding) in October; off since 7.25l defeat at Dundalk in November and hooded for return; place claims if reproducing the form of that Naas effort.

runners.name: Suerte
runners.comment: Behind Bonus Time latest, improve for that, sister to 1m Group 1 winner, interesting
runners.spotlight: Went close on second start over 6f at Dundalk in January; behind Bonus Time when a staying on 6l fourth of 10 at Cork in May; may strip fitter for that and she's a full sister to 1m American Grade 1 winner River Boyne; this stiffer 6f should suit her better; interesting.

runners.name: Yquem
runners.comment: Nicely bred Wootton Bassett filly, well beaten at 33-1 on debut, others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Nicely bred daughter of Wootton Bassett but she was 33-1 when slowly away and well-beaten on debut at Cork (6f, good) behind a couple of these rivals; could take a step forward from that but others make more appeal.

8:25.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (Watering) (Racing on Stands' side)

runners.name: Shigar
runners.comment: Below form on AW and on reappearance at Cork last twice; has a shout if back to best
runners.spotlight: Won at Navan last August off 1lb lower; was below that form on AW and on reappearance at Cork since; has a shout if getting back to best.

runners.name: Bucaneers Spirit
runners.comment: No luck in-running at Roscommon but was below best again at Cork three days ago
runners.spotlight: Won fast-ground handicaps over this trip at Cork and Navan last year; no luck in-running at Roscommon two starts back but was below best again at Cork three days ago.

runners.name: Anvika
runners.comment: Runner-up over this trip at Dundalk in January but below form twice since over 7f
runners.spotlight: AW maiden winner took a 7f Limerick handicap last year off 1lb lower; runner-up over this trip at Dundalk in January but below form twice since over 7f; needs her best.

runners.name: Pier Pressure
runners.comment: Two decent runs in defeat lately including at Roscommon last time when slowly away
runners.spotlight: Dual AW winner won a Gowran handicap over this trip last summer; some decent runs in defeat since including at Roscommon last time when slowly away; one to consider.

quotes.race: Gateway Hotel Dundalk Race & Stay Maiden
quotes.quote: Pier Pressure travelled into it nicely, He was still green and had a good look when he got there but he won snug enough - Jack Kearney, rider

runners.name: Catena Zapata
runners.comment: Poor in two starts since returning from an absence; yard flying but not easy to fancy
runners.spotlight: Dual AW winner over this trip and has run well in defeat over hurdles at times too; poor in two starts since returning from an absence; yard flying but not easy to fancy.

quotes.race: Test Your Tipping Talents At PUNTERS.HOLLYWOODBETS.COM Every Dundalk Meeting Race (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Catena Zapata improved a lot from the first day and the step up to a mile suited him. I didn't want to make it but I didn't want them to go too slow. He really stuck his neck out. He's a lovely big horse and should get 1m2f next season - Billy Lee, rider

runners.name: Dark Viper
runners.comment: Solid effort off 2lb higher at Cork three days ago over 7f; considered back up to 1m
runners.spotlight: Finally got off the mark when winning over this trip at Leopardstown in March and a solid effort off 2lb higher at Cork three days ago over 7f; considered back up to 1m.

quotes.race: Legacy Wine Bar Handicap
quotes.quote: If there was ever a horse who deserved a win it's Dark Viper. He's a stable favourite and a good lead horse. He had a blow at the Curragh so we knew he would step forward fitness-wise and I think the better ground and step up in trip suited. It wouldn't surprise me if he went in again - Shane Foley, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: After failing to get his head in front in his first 19 starts, he finally did it at Leopardstown the other day. I was beginning to wonder if he ever would but thank God he did. You could run him every day of the week if you needed to. Seven furlongs or a mile, either trip is no problem to him at all. 23-04-25

runners.name: Ocean Manifest
runners.owner: J Kirkland & Mrs J M Ryan
runners.comment: Makes seasonal/stable and handicap debut now; needs a return to debut run
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in a 7f Fairyhouse maiden on debut last year but was below that level twice after; makes seasonal/stable and handicap debut now; needs a return to debut form.

runners.name: Port Louis
runners.comment: Won at Cork last time; raised 4lb but should get another strong pace to chase today
runners.spotlight: Won for the second time when taking a Cork handicap over this trip last time; raised 4lb but should get another strong pace to chase today and be finishing well again.

quotes.race: Racing Again Saturday, May 10th Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Noel (Meade) told me Port Louis can be quirky and keen, and I didn't want to interfere with him too much. I gave him a little rein, didn't touch off his mouth, and it worked out lovely as we went a good pace - Wayne Hassett, jockey speaking to RacingTV.

runners.name: Mags
runners.comment: Won on AW last winter; up 3lb and in class on return so others make more appeal
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark when winning a 1m handicap at Dundalk last November; up 3lb and in class on return so others make more appeal.

quotes.race: Irishinjuredjockeys.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Mags is a big, raw filly and we need to let her mature a bit more. I'm glad we can close off the year for her and job done with a winner. It is nice to see a horse that is going forward at the line - Kieran Cotter, trainer

runners.name: Free Solo
runners.comment: Won over 7f at this track last time; has won over this trip too but is up 8lb and in class
runners.spotlight: Got back on the scoresheet when winning with a bit in hand over 7f at this track last time; has won over this trip too but is up 8lb and in class so needs more again.

quotes.race: Frank Conroy Irish EBF Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Finally we got a colt to win. Free Solo learned a lot at Naas and he was just a baby there. He jumped out and stopped rather than jumping and going. He was a different horse today. He'll improve with racing - Jessica Harrington, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He has had only six runs in his life but has shown plenty of ability. A winner over a mile, he finished runner-up in successive Listed races last season. I think he'll progress this year and is definitely capable of winning at that level. I feel he's probably best over seven furlongs. 17-03-21

runners.name: Moyassr
runners.comment: Was 1.75l behind Port Louis at Cork last time; 6lb better off now so not much between them
runners.spotlight: AW winner over this trip last winter has run solid races both starts this term; was 1.75l behind Port Louis at Cork last time but is 6lb better off today so there shouldn't be much between them; cheekpieces re-applied.

runners.name: Touch The Sound
runners.comment: Well below best form over 7f at this track on return but can do better
runners.spotlight: Won a Dundalk maiden over this trip last November and a solid effort over 7f next time; well below that level over 7f at this track on return but can do better.

runners.name: Buckle And Bolts
runners.comment: Raced too freely in blinkers at Ballinrobe last time; headgear removed; others preferred
runners.spotlight: The best of four maiden runs came over C&D on soft on debut; raced too freely in blinkers at Ballinrobe last time; the headgear is removed but others make more appeal.

runners.name: Showhound

prev_owners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd

runners.comment: Just denied over 7f here on debut for this yard but was below that form here again since
runners.spotlight: Won on turf and AW up to 7f when trained in UK; just denied over 7f here on debut for this yard but was below that form behind Free Solo here again since; has to rebound.

runners.name: Pansy Poe
runners.comment: Poor at Sligo on seasonal/stable debut; this trip a query and others make more appeal
runners.spotlight: Maiden has been placed several times over sprint trips including at this track; was poor at Sligo on seasonal/stable debut; this trip a query and others make more appeal.

runners.name: Mapa
runners.comment: Form tailed-off when last seen; needs her best on seasonal/handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Some decent efforts in defeat in maidens last year but her form tailed-off when last seen; needs her best on seasonal and handicap debut.

runners.name: Red Hugh Odonnell
runners.comment: No luck behind Free Solo over 7f here; tough task at Killarney last time; a player today
runners.spotlight: Has run well in defeat at times in maidens and handicaps up to this trip; got no luck behind Free Solo over 7f here before facing a tough task at Killarney last time; a player back in this grade.

runners.name: Everylittlestep
runners.comment: Runner-up in this race last year off 5lb higher; poor on soft ground on return; a player
runners.spotlight: Won three on the bounce in 2023; hasn't added to that since but was runner-up in this race last year off 5lb higher; was poor on unsuitably soft ground on return but can leave that form behind; player.

quotes.race: BOYLESPORTS Supporting Irish Racing Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Everylittlestep seemed to do it nicely there. She has won three now so we might aim for a bit of prize money and try to get in off a low weight in one of those big handicaps. There's a couple of fillies' only handicaps coming up that she might sneak into the bottom of. We'll see what the handicapper does, if he is very hard on her we might have no option but to turn her back out at the Curragh on Sunday. She likes a gap between her races but we might try it if he gives us no choice - Andrew Latta, stable representative.

quotes.race: Rose Hotel Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Everylittlestep was running well last year without winning. We got her wind done and it just took a couple of runs to get her confidence back. We'll see what the handicapper does and we might look at Galway - Andrew Latta, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Ransom
runners.comment: Never involved at Roscommon after an awkward start last time; is better than that
runners.spotlight: Five-time AW winner is a maiden on turf; never involved at Roscommon after an awkward start last time; better than that but others appeal more.

quotes.race: Betway Maiden Stakes
quotes.quote: Ransom is a nice type of horse. He ran a little bit green but you'd be happy with what he's done today. It might not have been a strong maiden but he'll build on this and hopefully has a bit of a future - Ryan Moore, jockey.

runners.name: Thompson Gunner
runners.comment: Poor when last seen on AW and back on turf at this track; others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Maiden has gone closest on AW but was poor when last seen on that surface and back on turf at this track; others appeal more.

runners.name: Auburn Avenue
runners.comment: Beaten 5l by Free Solo over 7f at this track last time; this trip is a better fit for her
runners.spotlight: Maiden was beaten 5l by Free Solo over 7f at this track last time; however, this trip is a better fit for her and she can put up an improved effort.

runners.name: Cordouan
runners.breeder: S N C Ecurie De Castillon Et Al
runners.comment: Fair run at Roscommon last time when hampered at the start; down 2lb and not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Won a Gowran claimer last August and best effort in four runs since was at Roscommon last time when hampered at the start; down 2lb and not ruled out.

quotes.race: Gilna's Cottage Inn (Q.R.) Race
quotes.quote: Cordouan is a good horse. We bought him from Gosden's, he had not run for over 500 days. He's had a few bits of problems but hopefully we have ironed them out and you could see him in premier handicaps next year - Ado McGuinness, trainer.

runners.name: Nahori
runners.comment: Poor in testing ground on debut for this yard but can do better under these conditions
runners.spotlight: Some decent runs in defeat, incl'over C&D, while dropping in the handicap last year; poor in testing ground on debut for this yard but can do better under these conditions.

runners.name: Eco Pete
runners.comment: Course bumper winner in 2021, hurdles form is unconvincing, poor over fences lately
runners.spotlight: Course bumper winner in 2021, hurdles form is unconvincing, poor over fences lately; debatable if he can run up to an official rating of 102, which would give him a chance of being involved.

quotes.race: Molson Coors Beverage Company INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Eco Pete was quite good. He stayed well and he's fit. We might put him away and bring him back in the spring - John McConnell, trainer.

runners.name: Jazz De Cotte
runners.comment: Bumper winner, excuse on hurdling debut, beaten 10l at Naas but makes plenty of appeal now
runners.spotlight: Second in a point; won Ayr winners' bumper on soft last season; reported coughing on hurdling debut; stayed on to chase home an easy winner over 2m at Naas early last month; makes plenty of appeal over this longer trip, though the concession of 8lb to Hills Of Glory is problematic.

stable_tour.quote: He won a bumper at the Scottish Grand National meeting at Ayr. He's got a lot stronger since then, too, and he's one we're looking forward to sending over hurdles. 28-10-24

runners.name: Guest Star
runners.comment: Won Dundalk claimer in January, his only success from 29 Flat starts, weak hurdles form
runners.spotlight: Won Dundalk claimer in January, his only success from 29 Flat starts; weak hurdles form

runners.name: Cap Bernat
runners.owner: Robin Mcneilly & Mrs Dorothy Mcneilly & Paul Mcneilly
runners.comment: Makes his hurdling debut at the age of 12, twice runner-up in bumpers at this venue
runners.spotlight: Makes his hurdling debut at the age of 12, twice runner-up in bumpers at this venue, including when just touched off last July; top rider booked.

runners.name: Centaq
runners.comment: Has shown a degree of promise in both outings, will probably need to get a handicap mark
runners.spotlight: Has shown a degree of promise in maiden hurdle outings at Naas and Down Royal; will probably need to get a handicap mark.

runners.name: Firstupbestdressed
runners.comment: Has struggled at three-figure odds in maidens at Fairyhouse and this venue
runners.spotlight: Has struggled at three-figure odds in maidens at Fairyhouse and this venue.

runners.name: Garadice
runners.comment: Pulled up in two points, remote sixth on hurdling debut at Sligo, up against it
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in two points; remote sixth on hurdling debut at Sligo, up against it.

runners.name: Hills Of Glory
runners.comment: Naas second last December gives him a definite chance, fair fifth in a handicap on latest
runners.spotlight: Point winner; went very close in a Naas maiden hurdle last December; heavy ground probably unsuitable on next start; fair fifth in a Kilbeggan handicap on latest; 105-rated gelding may take advantage of 8lb concession from bumper winner Jazz De Cotte.

runners.name: North Account
runners.comment: 100-1 when down the field at Down Royal on debut, unlikely to feature
runners.spotlight: 100-1 when down the field at Down Royal on debut; unlikely to feature.

runners.name: Parkgarve
runners.comment: Half-brother to Slade Steel, shaped promisingly on his hurdling debut at Sligo
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to Supreme Novices' winner Slade Steel; raced too keenly on debut in Down Royal bumper a year ago; shaped promisingly when third in a maiden hurdle at Sligo ten days ago; open to improvement.

runners.name: Reinado
runners.comment: Fourth in a small-field bumper, major improvement needed from his first three hurdle runs
runners.spotlight: Fourth in a small-field bumper last December; major improvement needed from his first three hurdle runs

runners.name: The Cistercian
runners.comment: Dam an unraced half-sister to ill-fated Champion Bumper winner Fayonagh, hood/tongue-tie
runners.spotlight: First foal; unraced dam closely related to bumper/hurdle winner Butch Cassidy, half-sister to ill-fated Champion Bumper/2m hurdle winner Fayonagh; family of Solerina; hood and tongue-tie on for debut.

runners.name: Welcome Back
runners.comment: Point winner, let down by his jumping in a hunters' chase and a maiden hurdle
runners.spotlight: Won a point-to-point at Tinahely (subsequent bumper winner in third); 11-2 when jumping poorly and falling on rules debut in a Thurles maiden hunter chase in March; unseated at the first in a maiden hurdle at Sligo; trainer also runs Jazz De Cotte.

runners.name: Neverseenhimcoming
runners.comment: Dam won on Flat and over hurdles, pulled up both starts in points, blinkered
runners.spotlight: Dam won on Flat and over hurdles; pulled up both starts in points; transformation needed; blinkered, top jockey aboard.

runners.name: Glossary
runners.comment: No apparent chance on the evidence of two bumper runs last year, hooded now
runners.spotlight: No apparent chance on the evidence of two bumper runs last year; hooded now.

runners.name: Rynok Square
runners.comment: First reserve, huge price on debut at Down Royal, never in contention, can be ruled out
runners.spotlight: Huge price on debut at Down Royal, never in contention; can be ruled out; first reserve.

runners.name: Slea Head
runners.comment: Second reserve, pulled up lame on debut, completely tailed off at Down Royal
runners.spotlight: Pulled up lame on debut; completely tailed off at Down Royal; second reserve.

5:35.race_name: Frank And Brian Fitzsimons Memorial Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Son Of Hypnos
runners.comment: Hit hard by the handicapper for bolting up in a 2m handicap at last year's Galway Festival
runners.spotlight: Soft ground was an excuse on final run (October) but he was hit hard by the handicapper for bolting up in a 2m handicap hurdle at last year's Galway Festival; others might be better in.

quotes.race: Easyfix Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We've had an eye on Galway for a while with Son Of Hypnos and it's great when it works out. It's my first festival winner. It's fantastic for James to ride a winner here as he's been coming since he was a child - Kevin Smith, trainer.

quotes.race: Oola Handicap
quotes.quote: Son Of Hypnos stays well, is pretty uncomplicated and Colin said he was happy enough to take a lead as they were going hard enough. The cheekpieces worked well on him the last day and we left them on today - Matt Smith, trainer

runners.name: Roaring Potter
runners.comment: With Gordon Elliott when the 2-5 winner of 2m5f maiden hurdle here nearly three years ago
runners.spotlight: With Gordon Elliott when the 2-5 winner of a 2m5f maiden hurdle here nearly three years ago and has been off since; changed hands for 22,000euros and would need to see some confidence behind him after so long on the sidelines; tries a tongue-tie.

stable_tour.quote: He hasn't been the easiest horse to train but he's won his maiden hurdle now, so it's onwards and upwards. He's a smart sort. 18-10-22

runners.name: Goodie Girl
runners.comment: Below par last time after a heavy fall at Leopardstown where she held every chance
runners.spotlight: Dual winner and had every chance when taking a heavy late fall at Leopardstown (2m4f, yielding) two runs ago; that was her second tumble on the trot and was perhaps thinking of those when below par a month ago; however, the ability is there to go close.

quotes.race: Protection & Prosperity Financial Services Supporting Louth GAA Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: That was straightforward from Goodie Girl. I brought her here on Monday but brought her home as I thought the ground was a bit too quick for her. I walked the track the morning and I was happy with it. Patrick said that she travelled well, jumped well. She was a nice mare last year and hopefully she'll come on from the run - Dermot McLoughlin, trainer.

quotes.race: Try Racing TV For Free Now At racingtv.com/freetrial Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Goodie Girl is progressive. She was tough and finished out the race well. She should improve. She's tough and hardy and I like her - Dermot McLoughlin, trainer.

runners.name: Rockview Consort
runners.comment: Under 7l away on her belated return to hurdling over C&D two weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Wasn't in bad form on the AW through the winter and was under 7l away on her belated return to hurdling over C&D two weeks ago; must have some sort of chance.

quotes.race: Bluegrass Horse Feeds Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Rockview Consort  jumped well. John (McConnell) does a good job schooling his horses at home, he doesn't like to miss with these nice ones first-time out. I kept it simple, it was a nice even gallop and you can do that around here on good ground. It was a pretty good performance and she's one we'll look forward to - Ben Harvey, jockey, talking to Racing TV

quotes.race: Irishinjuredjockeys.com Maiden
quotes.quote: Rockview Consort probably wants further but we said we would have another crack at this trip. It is great to get the win and she will go on turf as well - John McConnell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She took a while to win her maiden but did so nicely at Dundalk last time over 1m2½f. She has a 3lb higher rating on the turf and, having given her a break after that success, she'll be brought back for 1m4f handicaps on the grass. She also jumps well and is a possible for some hurdling this summer. 06-04-23

runners.name: Arcland
runners.comment: Has threatened off this mark in the past and joining Gavin Cromwell heightens interest
runners.spotlight: 1-22 on the Flat and 0-13 over hurdles; has threatened off this sort of mark in the past and joining Gavin Cromwell has to heighten interest.

quotes.race: Happy Retirement Eamonn Lloyd Apprentice Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: He'll go jumping after that and should make a nice hurdle horse as he jumps well - trainer Harry Rogers.

runners.name: Depalma
runners.comment: Off since Christmas but he's still lightly raced and not yet exposed
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in a Wexford maiden and was a 10l ninth of 19 in his third handicap start at Leopardstown last time; has been off since Christmas but he's still lightly raced and not yet exposed.

runners.name: Wrecking Ball Paul
runners.comment: AW and hurdle winner but struggling for form this year; chasing the last twice
runners.spotlight: Hasn't taken to fences the last twice but those were after some underwhelming runs on the Flat and over hurdles; bit to prove right now.

quotes.race: Peter K. Hits The Big 50 (Q.R.) Handicap
quotes.quote: Wrecking Ball Paul went very well and I didn't actually realise how much of a gap there was until I came round the home bend. I knew then I had lots of horse left under me and I wasn't too worried. Paul (Mulligan, trainer) said to get a breather into him and I gave him one down the back, but I didn't realise how far ahead I was - Kevin Healy, jockey.

quotes.race: Axa Farm Insurance Midlands National Day Friday 14th July Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Wrecking Ball Paul has been knocking on the door,. He is a bit of a headcase and needs settling down but Ben Harvey is a seriously good jockey, he did exactly what he was told. He ran at Listowel yesterday and it just took the edge off him - Paul Mulligan, trainer

runners.name: Splendid Choice
runners.comment: Narrow Wexford winner last week; up 5lb with Tiernan Power Roche again claiming his 5lb
runners.spotlight: Questionable whether he's improving but arrives here after two good efforts, last week battling on well to edge home over 2m1f at Wexford (good); 5lb higher here with Tiernan Power Roche again claiming his 5lb; solid chance.

runners.name: Peckham Springs
runners.comment: Last win was nearly three years ago and hasn't offered much in his three starts this year
runners.spotlight: Only 2-35 overall and last win came here nearly three years ago; hasn't offered much in his three starts this year.

quotes.race: Steel Lintels Ireland Ltd 10th Anniversary Opportunity Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Peckham Springs did it well. He had been running in snatches but he travelled the whole way and jumped well. The cheekpieces helped - Dermot McLoughlin, trainer.

quotes.race: Thanks To All Our Sponsors In 2020 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: He ran well on the Flat and is probably good enough to win a maiden at some stage but we'll concentrate on jumping for the moment. He loves that ground. From day one he was a very good jumper and I always had faith in him - Paul Stafford, trainer

runners.name: Demanding Gerry
runners.comment: 0-7 and off since November, but lightly raced and has hinted at winning potential
runners.spotlight: 0-7; penultimate run was encouraging as she was with the leaders when making a bad mistake three out (2m4f, good); below that level last time but the tongue-tie tried then is now removed; off since November.

6:05.race_name: Down Royal Corporation Of Horse Breeders Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Sights Unseen
runners.comment: Running well and chased home the in-form favourite over C&D two weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Bang there in 2m1f/2m handicaps before chasing home the in-form favourite over C&D two weeks ago (good); goes well for Alix Balfe and another competitive show looks on the cards.

runners.name: Mazzas Mahler
runners.comment: Low mileage but has questions to answer on a few counts now entering handicap company
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 9yo; second in a Tramore maiden hurdle last year and again made the frame in her latest point; still has some questions to answer on a few counts now entering handicap company.

runners.name: Truly Elegant
runners.comment: Well held in her maiden hurdles but those efforts weren't devoid of promise
runners.spotlight: Well held in her maiden hurdles but those efforts weren't devoid of promise, nor one of her bumper runs; could be interesting on this switch to handicaps.

runners.name: True Destiny
runners.breeder: M J & L A Taylor Llp

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Sultan Ahmad Sha
H R H Sultan Ahmad Shah

runners.comment: On a losing run but ran another good race in defeat at Sligo ten days ago; chance
runners.spotlight: 0-14 since his last win at Sligo nearly two years ago but has run some good races on occasions and emerged from well off the pace to be fourth back at Sligo ten days ago (2m4f, good); enters the reckoning.

runners.name: Robindevidastar
runners.comment: Form has run cold since finishing second at Clonmel in January
runners.spotlight: Thoroughly exposed hurdler with a strike-rate of 3-32 in this discipline and form has run cold since finishing second at Clonmel in January.

quotes.race: William Hill Ireland Extra Places Every Day Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Robindevidastar had never had a gallop on grass but I was confident he would run a big race, I don't think he would want very heavy ground - Philip Rothwell, trainer.

runners.name: Every River
runners.comment: Tailed off in a Down Royal maiden 18 days ago on his return from a mammoth absence
runners.spotlight: 100-1 when tailed off in a Down Royal maiden 18 days ago on his return from a mammoth absence; wouldn't be the obvious answer on his handicap debut.

runners.name: Sir Carnegie
runners.comment: Stayed on for third over 2m6f at Down Royal before let down by his jumping at Kilbeggan
runners.spotlight: Stayed on for third over 2m6f at Down Royal before let down by his jumping at Kilbeggan (3m); looks to have a race in him off this mark.

runners.name: Dylans Chance
runners.comment: Might be happier back on drier ground but hard to make a solid chase on his form so far
runners.spotlight: Might be happier back on drier ground but hard to make a solid chase on his form so far.

runners.name: Tiny Angel
runners.comment: Has little to show for her three efforts in handicap company
runners.spotlight: Has little to show for her three efforts in handicap company and makes limited appeal despite her reduced mark.

runners.name: Aussie Warrior
runners.comment: Not bred for chasing but couldn't put a line through him given peak hurdling form
runners.spotlight: Recent efforts weren't his best but testing ground was an excuse last time and he was competitive in handicap hurdles last summer; not bred for chasing but couldn't put a line through him.

runners.name: Coffeys Forge
runners.comment: Belated chase debut at the age of nine but pick of hurdling form brings him into this
runners.spotlight: Placed in two handicap hurdles earlier this year but ran poorly last time when heavy ground was no excuse; chance if shrugging aside that disappointment, for all that this is a belated chase debut at the age of nine.

runners.name: Darkened
runners.owner: John C Mcconnell & Donal Mc Ardle
runners.comment: Was running well before finishing second in a claiming hurdle last time; new yard
runners.spotlight: 9yo who has had a lot of racing and steered clear of fences since finishing fourth of seven at Clonmel two years ago; however, was running well before finishing second in a claiming hurdle last time and he's now with John McConnell.

quotes.race: Axa Smart Farm Insurance Midlands National Day Friday 8th July Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Darkened went on and did it well to the line. He was comfortable the whole way - J.J. Slevin, rider.

quotes.race: Ardilaun Hotel Handicap
quotes.quote: Darkened could be nice for a bigger handicap later in the year. It took us a while to figure him out and he had a few issues, but he is where we want him now and hopefully he can keep progressing - Denis Hogan, trainer.

runners.name: Royal Reprobate
runners.comment: Two of three runs in handicap hurdles for current yard weren't too shoddy
runners.spotlight: Didn't last long with Gavin Cromwell; two of three runs in handicap hurdles for current yard weren't too shoddy but probably best watched now chasing.

runners.name: Younowhatimean
runners.comment: Ran well enough in a handicap hurdle when last seen in November to merit some attention
runners.spotlight: Winning pointer; 13 defeats under rules include two hunter chases and a handicap in this discipline; however, ran well enough in a handicap hurdle when last seen in November to merit some attention.

runners.name: Gina Moon
runners.comment: Modest hurdler but lightly raced and could make a better chaser as breeding offers hope
runners.spotlight: Modest hurdler who failed to raise her profile on handicap debut at Perth (2m4f, good), where she was weak in the betting at 16-1 despite Sean Bowen riding; could make a better chaser as breeding offers hope.

runners.name: Speranza Wilde
runners.comment: Modest hurdler but did win a point so chasing could be more her thing
runners.spotlight: No more than minor promise over hurdles but hasn't had a lot of racing and she did win a point, so chasing could be more her thing.

runners.name: Tankardstown Diva
runners.comment: Non-stayer over 2m7f last time and could have a part to play over this shorter distance
runners.spotlight: Strike-rate of 1-13 over hurdles and now 0-5 as a chaser after a 15l defeat in handicap company here two weeks ago; didn't appear to stay the 2m7f that day and could have a part to play over this shorter distance.

quotes.race: Choose Fibrus Broadband Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I was a bit worried about stepping up in trip with Tankardstown Diva as she can be hard on herself but she's learning - Ian Donoghue, trainer.

runners.name: Chiefs Kingdom
runners.comment: Fair form over hurdles and has also run well in a beginners' chase, good chance here
runners.spotlight: Placed in four of his nine starts over hurdles; fair fourth of ten in a Wexford beginners' chase 13 months ago before well beaten at Limerick; back from 283-day absence when second in Ballycahane maiden point-to-point in March for Aidan Fitzgerald; back with Paul Nolan, leading chance.

runners.name: Grageen
runners.comment: Second in this race 12 months ago but looks vulnerable on more recent form
runners.spotlight: Second in this race 12 months ago; 2-12 in points; placed in three small-field events during the autumn campaign, including twice behind the progressive Willitgoahead; down the field in a maiden hunter chase at Limerick in December; never competitive in the Ladies' Cup at Punchestown.

runners.name: King In The Park
runners.comment: 2-14 in points, with both victories gained in recent months, top rider aboard, cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: 2-14 in points, with both victories gained in recent months; unseated early at Necarne two weeks ago, previously a narrow winner at Taylorstown; no track experience; top rider aboard; cheekpieces.

runners.name: Mellow Glory
runners.comment: Weak form in points, pulled up at Thurles, struggled in the Ladies' Cup at Punchestown
runners.spotlight: Weak form in points; three-figure odds when pulled-up in a hunters' chase at Thurles in March; struggled in the Ladies' Cup at Punchestown.

runners.name: Squire Ohara
runners.comment: Deserved his point win after several placed efforts, another sound effort at Punchestown
runners.spotlight: Point winner at Loughanmore in April after four consecutive placed efforts; improved on previous racecourse form when runner-up in the confined Bishopscourt Cup at Punchestown; only four finishers, winner Fountain House is much superior to a typical Bishopscourt runner.

runners.name: Western Wishes
runners.comment: Has won only one of his 18 starts in points, moderate third at Loughanmore last time
runners.spotlight: Has won only one of his 18 starts in points; moderate third at Loughanmore last time, with shorter-priced Yewtree Hill back in sixth.

runners.name: Yewtree Hill
runners.comment: Won twice in points during the winter, soundly beaten on last two outings
runners.spotlight: Won twice in points during the winter; soundly beaten on last two outings; finished behind Western Wishes on latest; both horses have changed stable in the interim.

7:37.race_name: Dennison Commercials, Volvo Truck Hunters Chase

runners.name: Asphalt Cowboy
runners.comment: Course winner after promising second at Thurles, possible to forgive Punchestown failure
runners.spotlight: 2-10 in points; promising 4l second to the smart Fountain House on his rules' debut at Thurles in March; won over an extended 2m7f here later that month, despite adverse circumstances; rider had to cope with a slipped saddle and lost iron early on the long run-in; began to labour after a collision at the ninth in Punchestown's Bishopscourt Cup; has plenty of ability.

runners.name: Champagne Court

prev_owners.owner: I F Gosden And DJ Coles

runners.comment: Six-time winner in Britain, points form term shows he retains an appetite for racing
runners.spotlight: Veteran won six races between 2018 and 2022 when trained by Jeremy Scott; still has an appetite for racing, twice runner-up in points for this rider in April; one length in front of Grange Soldier at Dromahane last time.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Handicap Hurdle (Pertemps Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Champagne Court ran over two and half miles last time on quick ground and it was too sharp. I was worried about the ground today, but it was three miles. We'll mix fences and hurdles and he's up to a mark I thought he couldn't win off, so to do it was a really good effort - Jeremy Scott, trainer.

quotes.race: Feeling Festive Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Champagne Court has run well twice this season so it's nice to get his head back in front. We were struggling over fences but he lost his way a little bit. It might be that we revert to fences now he's got his tail up. I think we've built up his confidence and had him so he was enjoying life - Jeremy Scott, trainer.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Follow Us On Twitter Novices' Limited Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I liked to think Champagne Court would improve over fences and it was a lot to ask him to jump round Sandown first time over fences but apart from one he was just about faultless. He is an exciting chaser and will stick to this trip and keep popping away in these novice handicaps where he can use his jumping to advantage - Jeremy Scott, trainer.

quotes.race: Reg Neeson 80th Birthday Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: We really love Champagne Court. That form from Cheltenham in the bumper has worked out really well and we knew he jumped well at home. The more we've done with him the better he's looked and hopefully he's an exciting prospect who will be better over a fence one day. We'll try and run him again over Christmas - Jeremy Scott, trainer

runners.name: Gorthill
runners.comment: Winner of four of his 16 starts in points, well held by Vina Ardanza on recent running
runners.spotlight: Winner of four of his 16 starts in points, 1-8 this season and beaten only a neck by Vina Ardanza at Kirkistown last November; however, well held by that rival on recent running at Toomebridge.

runners.name: Grange Soldier
runners.comment: Won a novice hunters' chase at Tipperary just over a year ago, must improve on recent form
runners.spotlight: 1-9 in points; career-best when winning a novice hunters' chase at Tipperary just over a year ago; closely matched with Champagne Court on recent Dromahane running.

runners.name: Macgiloney
runners.comment: Winner of 11 races under rules, getting on in years, out of his depth at Punchestown
runners.spotlight: Winner of 11 races under rules; won a point in March but never travelling when pulled up at Tattersalls in April; set a huge task in the championship event at Punchestown, always at the back, unseated three out.

quotes.race: Devon Inn Hotel Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Macgiloney travelled well and the further he went the better he jumped. When I needed a jump at the last he produced and galloped all the way to the line - Daniel King, rider.

quotes.race: Fingal Hygiene & Safety Rated Novice Chase
quotes.quote: Macgiloney has done it well enough and idled from the back of the second last. The further he goes the better he'll be. He's a fine big chasing type and will appreciate a bit of nice ground - Sean Flanagan, jockey

quotes.race: roscommonbound.ie Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Whatever Macgiloney did over hurdles was a bonus, and he won three times, so you'd imagine he'll have a big career novice chasing. He loves three miles plus and good ground. He's a very nice jumper and Sean gave him a lovely introduction. You couldn't be happier and he's exciting to have - Denis Hogan, trainer

quotes.race: Byrne Marquees Hilltown Hurdle
quotes.quote: I don't think the handicapper can react too much because I went through the form of the others and their ratings had maybe been got through good placing by Gordon. I didn't think in a handicap that they would have run to marks in the 130s. I'm thrilled with Macgiloney. He's always had a big future and he's still improving all the time. Chasing will be the job long term. He'll go to Galway now, whether he runs in the 3m handicap or the 2m4f novice. Killarney might come a bit soon - Denis Hogan, trainer-rider.

quotes.race: Examiner Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: He could have jumped a bit better and I had to be niggling away on him but he responded very well. I always thought I'd get there going down the back but Jack [Kennedy, aboard Foxy Jacks] slipped a few lengths on me.  This is a nice horse and he's been threatening to do that all last season. The beauty of now is that he's a novice for another season - those rated novices will suit him. He ran well at Punchestown, better than his finishing position suggests in good company. He's no bad horse, he won two bumpers last summer, but needs a trip - Denis Hogan, trainer/rider.

quotes.race: Loughnagore INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: It looked a strong bumper on paper, it's only ten days since Macgiloney was third in a maiden hurdle and he'd only one bit of minor work since so I was hopeful rather than confident - Denis Hogan, trainer

runners.name: Ontheropes
runners.comment: Former useful saying handicapper, dropped in class after three highly demanding tests
runners.spotlight: Contested some strong handicaps when with Willie Mullins, winning the 2021 Munster National and not beaten far in last year's Scottish National; out of his depth in the three major hunter chases of last season (Cheltenham, Aintree, Punchestown); sights are significantly lowered now; good chance if jumping better than at Punchestown.

quotes.race: JT McNamara Ladbrokes Munster National Handicap Chase (Grade A)
quotes.quote: It's my first time riding Ontheropes, and in fairness he was very straightforward. He got away well, had a little peck at the first but after that he jumped super everywhere. I was always comfortable, I had a lovely position, and I was conscious not to let him try to sprint too much. I built it up from the top of the hill and he was good at the last and he was always holding on a bit - Sean O'Keeffe, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He was very good in the Munster National on his first start after a break. His aim is the Ladbrokes Trophy at Newbury and it's so far so good in terms of his preparation. 02-11-21

His runs have been okay and he needs to hit better form. He is another who does not appreciate the heavy winter ground. He won the Munster National well and is a proper staying chaser so these are the races I will be entering him in over the next couple of years. 09-03-22

runners.name: Vina Ardanza
runners.comment: Bumper/hurdle/chase winner, has a clear edge over Gorthill on running early this month
runners.spotlight: Bumper/hurdle/chase winner; narrow point winner from Gorthill at Kirkistown last November; has a clear edge over that rival on recent Toomebridge running.

quotes.race: Thurles Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Vina Ardanza was a bit novicey and was probably a bit better than the short-head he won. He's more a horse for the spring and summer rather than winter heavy ground. He might get a break now and he will improve plenty - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We knew he'd be better over further than two miles. He was just touched off at Naas in November. That was a good run in a competitive race and I'd say he'll run in the Martin Pipe. 19-02-23

runners.name: Eyes Off Annie
runners.comment: Won a maiden hunters' chase at Cork, fair third behind stablemate Fountain House on latest
runners.spotlight: 2-5 in point-to-points, the wins coming on testing ground; second at Oldcastle in March after a 379-day break; showed the benefit of the run when winning a maiden hunters' chase at Cork; fair third behind talented stablemate Fountain House in the 2m4f Bishopscourt Cup at Punchestown; return to longer trip should suit.

8:07.race_name: Caherty Stables Racing Syndicate Point-To-Point INH Flat Race

runners.name: Better Times
runners.comment: Finished in front of the shorter-priced Cinammon Roll at Tipperary, definite chance
runners.spotlight: Dam of no account in France, but noteworthy as half-sister to the brilliant Quevega; best of three runs in points when second at Borris House in March; finished in front of the shorter-priced Cinammon Roll in his first bumper at Tipperary; Patrick Mullins aboard then, now partnered by a 7lb claimer who has ridden two winners in recent months.

runners.name: Chosen Leader
runners.comment: Pedigree is of some interest, no sign of winning potential in six starts in points
runners.spotlight: Dam has produced winners and is an unraced half-sister to Champion Bumper winner Cousin Vinny; no sign of winning potential in six starts in points; has a tongue-tie now.

runners.name: Cinammon Roll
runners.comment: Point winner on debut, finished behind Better Times at Tipperary, may have needed the run
runners.spotlight: First foal out of a French hurdles winner; changed hands for £80,000 after Ballycrystal win last December for Sam Curling; made low-key start on the track when dropping away in the final quarter-mile of a 2m2f Tipperary event 15 days ago; almost 6l to find with fourth-placed Better Times; may have needed the run.

runners.name: Coded Welder
runners.comment: Promising second on point debut last month, fell at the second at Necarne, tongue-tie
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to winners The Dellercheckout (chase), Begoodtoyourself (hurdle/chase) and Meet My Loreley (point and bumper); made a couple of mistakes when a promising second on point debut last month; fell at the second at Necarne 13 days ago; tongue-tie fitted.

runners.name: Found Beau
runners.comment: Half-brother to Gordon Elliott's Grade 1-winning chaser Found A Fifty, two runs in points
runners.spotlight: Noteworthy on pedigree as a half-brother to Gordon Elliott's Grade 1-winning chaser Found A Fifty; point-to-point form figures are potentially deceptive, last of six on debut and the only other finisher behind an easy winner in an incident-packed Stardbally event.

runners.name: Glenary
runners.comment: Failed to complete in two outings in points, appeared not to stay at Dromahane
runners.spotlight: First foal out of an unraced mare; failed to complete in two outings in points; appeared not to stay at Dromahane.

runners.name: Coolboy Christy
runners.comment: Showed a little when fourth on his second point-to-point run; others preferred.
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam twice-raced maiden pointer, half-sister to useful bumper/hurdle/chase winner Ericht; showed a little when fourth at Tattersalls on second point-to-point run; others preferred.

runners.name: Land The Plane
runners.comment: In good hands, needs to step up considerably on the form of two point-to-point attempts
runners.spotlight: Has a decent pedigree and is in good hands with a top rider aboard; needs to step up considerably on the form of two point-to-point attempts.

runners.name: Moody Girl
runners.comment: Made a satisfactory debut in a maiden point, unplaced favourite at Dromahane last month.
runners.spotlight: Plenty of stamina in the pedigree; made a satisfactory debut in a maiden point at Monksgrange in March; unplaced favourite at Dromahane last month.

runners.name: Noble Name
runners.comment: Point winner, made an encouraging bumper debut behind the two market leaders at Tipperary
runners.spotlight: Sister to Born Famous who won six consecutive races for Iain Jardine in 2023; half-sister to two other winners; beat a subsequent winner at Oldcastle on her third point start; 33-1 made an encouraging bumper debut when third behind the two market leaders at Tipperary; jockey has recently ridden his first point winner.
